name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease Type 4J
chief_complaint: I've been having trouble walking and my feet feel weak and numb
physical_findings: Distal muscle atrophy (legs more than arms)

lab_results.Nerve conduction studies: Severely slowed motor and sensory conduction velocities

treatment: Surgical tendon transfers for foot drop
prognosis: Slowly progressive disorder with significant disability over decades, but not life-threatening
description: A rare autosomal recessive subtype of Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease characterized by early-onset progressive sensorimotor neuropathy with both demyelinating and axonal features. Caused by mutations in the FIG4 gene affecting phosphoinositide metabolism in Schwann cells.
risk_factors: Certain ethnic backgrounds (higher prevalence in some populations)
